minus.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: used to show that one number or quantity is being subtracted from another
minus.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The payment will be refunded to you minus a small service charge.
minus.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: without something that would normally be there, or that used to be there
minus.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He came back minus a couple of front teeth.
minus.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: something that is a disadvantage because it makes a situation unpleasant
minus.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: There are both pluses and minuses to living in a big city.
minus.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: used to talk about a disadvantage of a thing or situation
minus.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: ‘Any minus points?’ ‘Well, the engine is rather noisy.’
On the minus side, there is no free back-up service if things go wrong.
minus.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: less than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures
minus.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: At night temperatures sometimes fall to minus 30°.
minus.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: used to show that you are taking one number or quantity from another
minus.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Net income is gross income minus income tax and National Insurance.
minus.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: a disadvantage or bad feature of something
minus.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: What are the pluses and minuses of practicing law in the private sector?
The car’s only minus point is that the engine is rather noisy.
